data.title: SPY ETF Daily Update, 2/26/2026
data.description:
The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) declined 0.56% today, February 26, driven primarily by a tech-sector selloff following Nvidia's (NVDA) Q4 earnings report, which failed to boost market confidence despite beating earnings expectations.

data.author: Radhika Saraogi

data.title: 'As Expected,' Top Analysts Praise Nvidia's Stellar Q4 Results
data.description:
Chip giant Nvidia (NVDA) delivered another solid quarterly performance, beating sales and earnings estimates amid rising AI demand from hyperscalers. TipRanks' five-star analysts expected Nvidia to surpass expectations, driven by high double-digit data center sales growth. TD Cowen analyst Joshua Buchalter reiterated his Buy rating and $235 price target, implying 20.2% upside potential. Similarly, Mizuho Securities analyst Vijay Rakesh maintained his Buy rating and $275 price target, suggesting 40.6% upside.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Nvidia Remains TD Cowen's Top Pick

Buchalter named Nvidia his "Top Pick," noting it makes "the extraordinary seem ordinary." The top four hyperscalers are expected to spend $650-$700 billion on capex this year, signaling "all systems go" at NVIDIA.

Buchalter expects growth through 2026, with revenue from Blackwell and Rubin platforms likely surpassing the $500 billion target. He noted that despite solid fundamentals, NVDA stock trades at a discount to historical valuations and peers, with investor skepticism on AI sustainability.

Rakesh Highlights Future Potential

Rakesh highlighted that Nvidia guided Q1FY26 revenue of $78 billion (+/- 2%), well above the $72.6 billion consensus, fueled by strong Blackwell ramps despite zero China revenue. He added that Rubin samples are now with customers and are on track for H2 2026 launch, targeting 10x inference cost reduction versus Blackwell.

Blackwell ramps continue strongly into H1 2026, with Rubin driving H2 and total demand exceeding $500 billion from inference and sovereign AI. He forecasts AI infrastructure market hitting $3 to $4 trillion by 2030, with agentic/physical AI and software-as-a-token driving growth.

Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy Now?

On TipRanks, Nvidia stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 34 Buys and one Sell rating. The average Nvidia price target of $267.48 implies 36.8% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, NVDA shares have surged 49%.
data.author: Sheryl Sheth

data.title: WBD Says Paramount's (PSKY) Offer is "Superior," Triggering a Four-Day Countdown for Netflix (NFLX)
data.description:
Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has taken a major step in its high‑stakes takeover battle. It said its Board of Directors has formally determined that Paramount Skydance's (PSKY) latest bid qualifies as a "Company Superior Proposal" when compared with its existing merger agreement with Netflix (NFLX). This move formally triggers a four-business-day matching period for Netflix to improve its bid.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Paramount Skydance's Bid Clears the Bar

WBD's board, after consulting its independent advisors, decided that Paramount Skydance's offer, valued at about $111 billion, provides more value and protection than the $83 billion deal currently on the table with Netflix.

The deal includes:

  • Purchase Price: $31.00 per WBD share in cash, up from a previous $30.00 offer.
  • Ticking Fee: A fee of $0.25 per share per quarter, beginning after September 30, 2026, to protect shareholders against closing delays.
  • Termination Protections: The deal includes a $7 billion regulatory termination fee if the deal fails to clear antitrust hurdles and a commitment to pay the $2.8 billion breakup fee WBD would owe Netflix.
  • Financial Backing: Larry J. Ellison and associated trusts have committed additional equity funding to ensure the solvency requirements of lending banks are met.
  • Asset Scope: Unlike Netflix, which primarily sought WBD's studios and HBO assets, Paramount Skydance intends to acquire the entire company, including its linear TV networks like CNN and Discovery.

NFLX Has Four Business Days to Respond

WBD has formally notified Netflix of its decision. Under the merger agreement, this notice opens a four‑business‑day matching window. During this period, Netflix can raise its bid or change deal terms to match or beat Paramount's proposal.

Once this period ends, WBD's board will review both proposals again. If, after reviewing any revisions from Netflix, the board still believes Paramount's bid is superior, WBD can end its merger agreement with Netflix and proceed with PSKY.

All attention now shifts to how Netflix will respond. The company must decide whether to improve its offer, hold its ground, or walk away. Meanwhile, WBD's board will continue to evaluate its future path with its advisors.

Which Stock Is a Better Buy?

We used TipRanks' Comparison Tool to line up all three companies in the takeover battle, to see which ones analysts favor. Below is a screenshot for reference. According to analysts, Netflix stock has the highest upside potential of 34.63%.
data.author: Radhika Saraogi

data.title: Mortgage Rates Sink Below 6% For First Time Since 2022
data.description:
The average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage rate in the U.S. has fallen below 6% for the first time since September 2022. The rate sits at 5.98%, down from 6.01% in the prior week and 6.76% a year ago, according to data from Freddie Mac (FMCC) released on Thursday.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Real estate experts note that mortgage rates in the psychological 5% range could attract more buyers into the market and result in higher demand for refinancing. The lower rates arrive just ahead of spring, a period that typically sees increased home-buying activity. "With a sub-6% rate, we'll get reliable sales growth across the country," said Compass Chief Economist Mike Simonsen.

Higher Costs May Limit Housing Demand

Others aren't so sure that lower rates will lead to higher demand. Whelan Advisory CEO Margaret Whelan notes that consumer sentiment remains subdued alongside a labor market that has shown signs of weakening. In addition, both electricity and home insurance costs have risen, making it more expensive to own a home.

Economists expect rates to stay in the high 5% to low 6% range for the remainder of the year. Fannie Mae (FNMA) expects an average rate of 6%, while the Mortgage Bankers Association predicts a 6.1% rate.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: Nvidia or AMD: Which Is the Best Chip Stock Post-Earnings, Meta Deals?
data.description:
American chip giants Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) both beat sales and earnings expectations in their fiscal fourth quarters. Moreover, both semiconductor companies have signed multiyear AI infrastructure deals with Meta Platforms (META), solidifying their positions in the booming AI market amid surging demand from hyperscalers like Meta, Microsoft (MSFT), and Google (GOOGL).

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Nvidia and AMD chips differ mainly in architecture, software ecosystems, and target strengths for gaming, AI, and data centers. Nvidia leads in high-end performance and AI dominance, while AMD focuses on value and capacity.

Based on TipRanks' Stock Comparison Tool, analysts have assigned a "Strong Buy" consensus to NVDA, while they remain cautiously optimistic on AMD's long-term prospects. Nonetheless, both stocks show similar upside potential over the next twelve months of around 35% to 37%, indicating strong share price appreciation ahead.
data.author: Sheryl Sheth

data.title: 'Heading Much Lower': Investor Sees More Downside Ahead for XRP
data.description:
People often bemoan the fact cryptocurrencies offer little real-world use. But that is not a problem XRP (XRP-USD) faces. The token was created to function as a bridge currency within the Ripple Payments network, enabling banks to process cross-border transfers instantly and at relatively low cost.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Last year, XRP reached a fresh all-time high, climbing to $3.65 per token in July. Since then, though, it has dropped 60.5% as part of the wider downturn across the crypto market.

The question now is whether its role in facilitating cross-border payments sets the scene for a comeback.

Investor Anthony Di Pizio is skeptical that will be the case. "Although XRP's use-case should, in theory, drive long-term upside, it's facing some structural issues that might be difficult to overcome," said the investor. "If history is any guide, these headwinds might fuel even more downside instead."

Cross-border bank transfers are often slow and expensive, largely because institutions rely on different systems, including the SWIFT (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication), which can require intermediaries to complete a transaction. Ripple Payments was designed to address that inefficiency by enabling banks to communicate and settle directly, making transfers near-instant and low cost. XRP was introduced as a bridge currency within the network, allowing, for example, a U.S. bank to send XRP instead of dollars to avoid foreign exchange friction. Transaction costs are negligible, typically just 0.00001 tokens, or a fraction of $0.01.

However, XRP's role is not essential. Ripple Payments also supports fiat transfers, meaning network growth does not automatically translate into higher demand for XRP. "That's a key reason why it tends to decline sharply during selloffs in the broader crypto markets – its performance is still very much determined by speculative investors," Di Pizio explained.

Banks also tend not to hold bridge currencies, immediately converting them into local currency, and XRP's volatility adds balance sheet risk. That dynamic became more pronounced after Ripple introduced its stablecoin, Ripple USD, in late 2024. With minimal price fluctuation, Ripple USD offers a more stable alternative for institutions, potentially reducing the need for XRP in cross-border transactions.

Prior to last year's high, XRP's previous peak came in 2018, after which the token lost more than 90% of its value within months and then spent most of the following five years below $1. Di Pizio thinks a "similar outcome is in progress right now."

Because Ripple Payments does not generate steady, structural demand for XRP, its price remains heavily influenced by speculative trading. Unless the token develops a compelling new use case that drives consistent adoption, it is likely to remain vulnerable to sharp selloffs during periods of broader crypto market uncertainty, limiting its prospects for "long-term value creation."

With that in mind, Di Pizio's forecast is a downbeat one. "If we simply follow history, I think XRP will be trading at somewhere between $0.30 and $0.50 five years from now," the investor summed up. "That assumes its 2025 high remains the peak for the foreseeable future, and that the decline reaches a similar magnitude to the 2018 decline with no meaningful recovery thereafter." (To watch Di Pizio's track record, click here)
data.author: Marty Shtrubel

data.title: Ahead of Q1 Earnings, Let's Look at Who Owns Broadcom Stock (AVGO)
data.description:
Broadcom (AVGO), a key player in semiconductor and infrastructure software solutions, has surged 88% over the past year, fueled by strong demand for its custom AI chips. The company is set to report its Fiscal Q2 2025 results on June 5, with Wall Street projecting earnings of $1.57 per share on revenue of $14.96 billion. Ahead of the results, several Top analysts have reiterated their Buy ratings. Among them is Citi's Top analyst Christopher Danely, who raised his price target on AVGO from $210 to $276, pointing to continued momentum from AI tailwinds. With earnings approaching, it's also a good time to take a closer look at who owns AVGO stock.

data.title: CRWV Earnings: CoreWeave Stock Drops on Wider-than-Expected Q4 Loss
data.description:
AI and cloud-computing company CoreWeave (CRWV) stock was down over 6% in after-hours trading after reporting fourth-quarter results.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The company posted a loss of $0.89 per share, which was much wider than the loss of $0.50 expected on Wall Street. A year earlier, CoreWeave reported a loss of $0.08 per share. Meanwhile, Q4 revenue surged 110.2% year-over-year to $1.57 billion, beating the consensus estimate of $1.53 billion.

Profitability Pressured as CoreWeave Scales

The company's rapid expansion continues to weigh on margins. Operating expenses more than doubled to $5.18 billion for the year, resulting in a full‑year operating loss of $46 million, compared with a $324 million operating profit in 2024.

Adjusted net loss for 2025 totaled $606 million, versus $65 million in the year-ago quarter, reflecting higher interest expense tied to CoreWeave's aggressive build‑out of AI data centers.

Massive $66.8B Revenue Backlog

Importantly, CoreWeave's revenue backlog surged to $66.8 billion, more than 4 times higher than where it started the year. CFO Nitin Agrawal said the backlog gives the company "exceptional visibility" as it scales into 2026 and beyond.

This backlog includes long‑term commitments from AI labs, hyperscalers, and large enterprises, many of whom are racing to secure GPU capacity amid unprecedented demand for AI compute.

Is CoreWeave a Good Stock to Buy?

Turning to Wall Street, CRWV stock has a Moderate Buy consensus rating based on nine Buy and eight Hold ratings. The average CoreWeave stock price target of $118.57 implies 20.72% upside potential.  It's worth noting that estimates will likely change following today's earnings report.
data.author: Radhika Saraogi

data.title: "Stunning" Film Studio Revival, More Planned, Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) Stock Slips Regardless
data.description:
Entertainment giant Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has not yet been purchased by a different studio. As such, it continues to run like a business should, and recently offered up some commentary about its prospects in the near future. It also showed off its quarterly numbers, which left some investors a bit displeased. Warner shares dropped fractionally in the closing minutes of Thursday's trading.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Naturally, the biggest question from investors was who was going to buy Warner. Warner executives did not rush to answer that question, but instead presented a look at what was likely to be coming in the near future. One of the big points was the future of the Warner cable channels. From CNN to TNT to Discovery and the rest, Warner declared that the spinoff was going well. In fact, HBO was looking forward to around 10 years' worth of marketing coming up as the Harry Potter series started up.

Gaming, meanwhile, would take a bit of a backseat for a while, Expensive flops like Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League proved to be a problem. Warner's gaming got "…distracted going after too many IP with too broad a set of studios." But the real win would be the film studios, which were poised for a "stunning" year going into 2027. Warner managed to land nine major hits in the last 14 months, reports noted.

But Then The Numbers Hit

Even as Warner made it clear its future looked great, its fourth quarter of 2025 figures were a bit of a downer. Warner posted total revenue of $9.46 billion, and boasted 131.6 million subscribers on its HBO Max operations. Yet, despite all that, Warner still managed to post a quarterly loss of $252 million.

Overall revenue was also down, about 6% against 2024's fourth quarter. Advertising revenue dropped 9%, and half of that loss went to the loss of the NBA broadcasts on its own. Global linear networks dropped another 12%, which makes it abundantly clear why Warner is looking to spin them off, and may also explain why valuing the linear channels has proven to be such a sticking point lately.

Is WBD Stock a Good Buy?

Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Moderate Buy consensus rating on WBD stock based on four Buys and eight Holds assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below. After a 162.73% rally in its share price over the past year, the average WBD price target of $29.66 per share implies 2.9% upside potential.
data.author: Steve Anderson

data.title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Dragged Down by Nvidia amid 'Positive' U.S.-Iran Talks
data.description:
The S&P 500 ETF (SPY) and the Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ) closed lower on Thursday, although both ETFs staged partial recoveries from their intraday lows.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Despite a double beat on both revenue and earnings, Nvidia (NVDA) ended the day with a 5.49% loss. NVDA is the largest holding in both SPY and QQQ with weights of 7.83% and 8.90%, respectively.

  • Revenue: $68.13 billion vs. $66.21 billion estimated
  • Data center revenue: $62.3 billion vs. $60.69 billion estimated
  • Adjusted EPS: $1.62 vs. $1.53 estimated
  • Fiscal First-Quarter Guidance: $78 billion plus or minus 2% vs est. $72.6 billion

The semiconductor leader's results weren't enough to ward off fears of an AI bubble, high customer concentration, and the sustainability of investments in AI. In addition, investors zoned in on Nvidia's purchase commitments, which rose by 90.2% quarter-over-quarter to $95.2 billion.

"The debate has shifted away from near-term results and toward the sustainability of AI capex spending, amid concerns around its quantum, monetization and potential cashflow degradation," said Janus Henderson portfolio manager Richard Clode.

Meanwhile, the U.S. and Iran held indirect nuclear talks in Geneva, with a senior U.S. official describing them as "positive." Omani Foreign Minister Badr al-Busaidi added that the two sides made "significant progress," with technical talks scheduled in Vienna next week. At the same time, key disagreements remain, with the U.S. calling on Iran to eliminate its 10,000-kilogram stockpile of enriched uranium. Iran rejected this proposal and pushed for low enrichment levels monitored by the International Atomic Energy Agency.

Before the market opened, the Department of Labor announced that initial jobless claims for the week ended February 21 rose by 4,000 to 212,000, below the consensus estimate of 216,000. Continuing jobless claims, which trail initial claims by a week, fell by 31,000 to 1.833 million and undershot expectations of 1.858 million. Initial jobless claims track new layoffs, while continuing claims reflect the level of ongoing unemployment.

Finally, the Trump administration is weighing its options to retain tariff revenue collected under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), according to Politico. Several options are on the table, including a proposal that contends tariffs collected over the past year comply with a new set of duties the administration is now implementing under different legal frameworks. Another option would allow companies to move to the front of the refund line by agreeing to forfeit part of the money to the government. Thousands of companies have already filed lawsuits seeking refunds, including Costco (COST) and FedEx (FDX).

The S&P 500 (SPX) closed with a 0.54% loss, while the Nasdaq 100 (NDX) fell by 1.16%.
data.author: Eddie Pan
